result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trina Yvette Basley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Trina Yvette Basley in court with attorney Rebecca M. Coffee.  Peter M. Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 13CM4074 for the purposes of sentencing.  Court ordered cash bail transferred to 13CM4074.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Letter from defense attorney Rebecca Coffee requesting case be transfered to Branch 40 for global resolution received and filed.  The court approves the transfer of this case to Branch 40, Judge Dallet, and it is placed on their calendar for plea on 07/29/2014 at 1:30pm.  Once plea is taken final pre-trial and jury trial dates will be vacated.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Trina Yvette Basley in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for final pretrial on 8-27-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 9-8-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 7-2-2014; discovery to be completed by 7-17-2014.  ls
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
and Witness List filed by the State

Defendant Trina Yvette Basley in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defnse is requesting a brief adjournment to review offer by the State.
Defense wishes to modify condition of bail as to defendant's return to work at Hamilton High School.  The state has no objection to the LIMITED modification as stated on the record.  The Court wants written verification from school officials.  The Court will accept a stipulation and order.  Case is adjourned to 6-2-2014 for pretrial.

Defendant Trina Yvette Basley in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Colleen Sturma.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

14RM020666  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-16-14

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SFS (DOB: 6-23-1998) or her home residence/family/work/school and no unsupervised contact with any child age 16 or under. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Trina Yvette Basley in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Defendant Trina Yvette Basley in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DA approved sooner date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
